On Wed, 05 Apr 2006, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

> The format you're discussing is probably supplied by Ant;

If this is the case, it isn't formally documented by Ant,
unfortunately.  Reverse-engineeting shouldn't be too hard since the
format is pretty simple, it should be possible just by looking the
code of Ant's XML formatter[1].

Stefan

Footnotes: 
[1]  http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/ant/core/trunk/src/main/org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/optional/junit/XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java?rev=278001&view=log
